bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 166, Number 61 (Friday, March 27, 2020)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mrs. McBATH:H.R. 6411.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article 1, Section 8.To regulate commerce with foreign nations, and among theseveral states, and with the Native American tribes;[Page H1865]

latestAction.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 455.

item.name: Emergency medical services and trauma care

item.text:
Emergency Advance Refill Notification Act of 2020

This bill requires private health insurance plans that cover prescription drugs to notify plan holders about the plan's policy concerning advance drug refills in response to a national or public health emergency. Specifically, the plan must notify plan holders in emergency areas whether the plan is waiving time limits on authorized prescription refills and, if so, the process for obtaining an early refill. Plans must issue such notification within five days of an emergency being declared.

Concerning the public health emergency declared in response to COVID-19 (i.e., coronavirus disease 2019), a plan must provide initial notification of its waiver policy not later than five days after this bill is enacted.
item.name: Introduced in House

bill.title: Emergency Advance Refill Notification Act of 2020

item.title: Emergency Advance Refill Notification Act of 2020
Emergency Advance Refill Notification Act of 2020

item.titleType: (Extracted from GPO) Short Titles as Introduced
item.title: Emergency Advance Refill Notification Act of 2020

To amend the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974, title XXVII of the Public Health Service Act, and the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to require group health plans and health insurance issuers offering group or individual health insurance coverage to provide notices relating to prescription drug refills to individuals covered under such plans or coverage who reside in emergency areas during emergency periods.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
